name: notebook_library
description:
Access your notebook library — organized document collections for token-efficient knowledge retrieval. Each notebook is a folder of documents (PDFs, text files, markdown) that are chunked, embedded, and indexed. Queries return only the most relevant passages (~2,500 tokens) instead of loading entire documents (50,000+). Use query_notebook as your primary way to look up information from your reference materials.

Actions:
- list_notebooks: See all available notebooks
- query_notebook: Semantic search within a notebook (requires notebook, query)
- browse_notebook: List documents in a notebook (requires notebook)
- read_document: Deep-read a specific document chunk by chunk (requires notebook, filename)
- create_notebook: Create a new notebook collection (requires name)
- notebook_stats: Get statistics about a notebook (requires notebook)
- sync_notebook: Re-sync a notebook after adding/changing files (requires notebook)
- remove_document: Remove a document from the search index (requires notebook, filename)

notebook.description: Notebook name (e.g., 'AiCara_Business', 'AI_Research'). Use list_notebooks to see available notebooks.

query.description: Search query for query_notebook. Be specific for better results.

n_results.description: Number of passages to return for query_notebook (default: 5, each ~500 tokens). RECOMMENDED: 3-5 to save context!

name.description: Notebook name for create_notebook (becomes a folder name, e.g., 'AI_Consciousness')

filename.description: Document filename for read_document or remove_document (from browse_notebook results)

chunk_start.description: Starting chunk index for read_document (0-based, default: 0)

chunk_end.description: Ending chunk index for read_document (-1 for all remaining, default: -1)
